title: The Clean Coder
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A code of conduct for professional programmers. Learn the disciplines, techniques, and tools of true software craftsmanship.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world where the only thing of value is the 'spice' melange.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: No matter your goals, Atomic Habits offers a proven framework for improving--every day. James Clear reveals practical strategies that will teach you exactly how to form good habits and break bad ones.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his new love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, of lavish parties on Long Island at a time when The New York Times noted 'gin was the national drink and sex the national obsession.'

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
author: Martin Kleppmann
description: Data is at the center of many challenges in system design today. Difficult issues need to be figured out, such as scalability, consistency, reliability, efficiency, and maintainability.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: Ryland Grace is the sole survivor on a desperate, last-chance mission--and if he fails, humanity and the earth itself will perish. A gripping space survival story.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: From a renowned historian comes a groundbreaking narrative of humanity’s creation and evolution—a #1 international bestseller.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: David Thomas, Andrew Hunt
description: The Pragmatic Programmer cuts through the increasing specialization and technicalities of modern software development to examine the core process--taking a requirement and producing working, maintainable code.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: The major New York Times bestseller that challenges our assumptions about decision making and our own minds.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first volume in The Lord of the Rings. Frodo Baggins must leave his home and make a perilous journey across Middle-earth to the Cracks of Doom.

title: Zero to One
author: Peter Thiel
description: The next Bill Gates will not build an operating system. The next Larry Page or Sergey Brin won’t make a search engine. Zero to One is about how to build companies that create new things.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: Marriage can be a real killer. One of the most critically acclaimed suspense writers of our time delivers a sharp, psychological thriller.

title: Salt, Fat, Acid, Heat
author: Samin Nosrat
description: A visionary new master class in cooking that distills decades of professional experience into just four simple elements.

title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
author: Douglas Crockford
description: Most programming languages contain good and bad parts. This book scrapes away the bad features to reveal a subset of JavaScript that's more reliable, readable, and maintainable.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: Born to survivalists in the mountains of Idaho, Tara Westover was seventeen the first time she set foot in a classroom. Her family was so isolated from mainstream society that there was no one to ensure the children received an education.

title: Introduction to Algorithms
author: Thomas H. Cormen
description: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to the modern study of computer algorithms. It covers a broad range of algorithms in depth, yet makes their design and analysis accessible to all levels of readers.

title: Shoe Dog
author: Phil Knight
description: In this candid and riveting memoir, for the first time ever, Nike founder and board chairman Phil Knight shares the inside story of the company’s early days.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: The matrix has its roots in primitive arcade games... Neuromancer was the first fully-realized glimpse of humankind’s digital future—a shocking vision that has challenged our assumptions about technology and ourselves.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
description: Rich Dad Poor Dad is Robert's story of growing up with two dads — his real father and the father of his best friend, his rich dad — and the ways in which both men shaped his thoughts about money and investing.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry Potter has never even heard of Hogwarts when the letters start dropping on the doormat at number four, Privet Drive. Addressed in green ink on yellowish parchment with a purple seal, they are swiftly confiscated by his grisly aunt and uncle.

title: You Don't Know JS: Scope & Closures
author: Kyle Simpson
description: No matter how much experience you have with JavaScript, odds are you don’t fully understand the language. This concise yet in-depth guide takes you inside scope and closures.

title: The Intelligent Investor
author: Benjamin Graham
description: The greatest investment advisor of the twentieth century, Benjamin Graham, taught and inspired people worldwide. Graham's philosophy of 'value investing' protects investors from substantial error.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: Alicia Berenson’s life is seemingly perfect. A famous painter married to an in-demand fashion photographer... until she shoots him five times in the face and then never speaks another word.

title: The Joy of Cooking
author: Irma S. Rombauer
description: The classic cookbook that has taught generations of Americans how to cook, now fully updated and revised.

title: Cracking the Coding Interview
author: Gayle Laakmann McDowell
description: I am not a recruiter. I am a software engineer. And as such, I know what it's like to be asked to whip up a brilliant algorithm on the spot and then write flawless code on a whiteboard.

title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: In a world where ash falls from the sky, and mist dominates the night, an evil cloaks the land and stifles all life. The future of the empire rests on the shoulders of a troublemaker and his young apprentice.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: Deep work is the ability to focus without distraction on a cognitively demanding task. It's a skill that allows you to quickly master complicated information and produce better results in less time.

title: Start with Why
author: Simon Sinek
description: Sinek starts with a fundamental question: Why are some people and organizations more innovative, more influential, and more profitable than others?

author: George Orwell
description: Among the seminal texts of the 20th century, Nineteen Eighty-Four is a rare work that grows more haunting as its futuristic purgatory becomes more real.

title: Head First Design Patterns
author: Eric Freeman
description: You know you don't want to reinvent the wheel, so you look to Design Patterns--the lessons learned by those who've faced the same software design problems. With Head First Design Patterns, you'll learn the patterns that matter.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: While in Paris, Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon is awakened by a phone call in the dead of the night. The elderly curator of the Louvre has been murdered inside the museum.

title: Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
description: Doing well with money isn’t necessarily about what you know. It’s about how you behave. And behavior is hard to teach, even to really smart people.

title: Clean Architecture
author: Robert C. Martin
description: By applying universal rules of software architecture, you can dramatically improve developer productivity throughout the life of any software system.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: Told in Kvothe's own voice, this is the tale of the magically gifted young man who grows to be the most notorious wizard his world has ever seen.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: In a life filled with meaning and accomplishment, Michelle Obama has emerged as one of the most iconic and compelling women of our era.

title: Refactoring
author: Martin Fowler
description: Refactoring is a controlled technique for improving the design of an existing code base. Its essence is applying a series of small behavior-preserving transformations.

title: Into Thin Air
author: Jon Krakauer
description: A bank of clouds was assembling on the not-so-distant horizon, but journalist-mountaineer Jon Krakauer, standing on the summit of Mt. Everest, saw nothing that suggested that a storm of unprecedented violence was coming.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Cixin Liu
description: Set against the backdrop of China's Cultural Revolution, a secret military project sends signals into space to establish contact with aliens.

title: Domain-Driven Design
author: Eric Evans
description: This book provides a broad framework for making design decisions and a technical vocabulary for discussing domain design.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: Based on more than forty interviews with Jobs conducted over two years, this is the riveting story of the roller-coaster life and searingly intense personality of a creative entrepreneur.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Since its immediate success in 1813, Pride and Prejudice has remained one of the most popular novels in the English language.

title: Eloquent JavaScript
author: Marijn Haverbeke
description: JavaScript lies at the heart of almost every modern web application. Eloquent JavaScript dives deep into the JavaScript language to show you how to write beautiful, effective code.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
description: In this artful, informative, and delightful book, Jared Diamond convincingly argues that geographical and environmental factors shaped the modern world.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: Harriet Vanger, a scion of one of Sweden's wealthiest families disappeared over forty years ago. A journalist and a hacker investigate.

title: Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion
author: Robert B. Cialdini
description: Influence, the classic book on persuasion, explains the psychology of why people say 'yes'—and how to apply these understandings.

title: Python Crash Course
author: Eric Matthes
description: A fast-paced, no-nonsense guide to programming in Python. This book teaches you how to write programs that do things.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: Long ago, in a time forgotten, a preternatural event threw the seasons out of balance. In a land where summers can last decades and winters a lifetime, trouble is brewing.

title: Principles: Life and Work
author: Ray Dalio
description: Ray Dalio, one of the world's most successful investors and entrepreneurs, shares the unconventional principles that he's developed, refined, and used over the past forty years.

title: Effective Java
author: Joshua Bloch
description: The definitive guide to Java's best practices, updated for Java 7, 8, and 9. It brings together over 75 key programming rules of thumb.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
description: In the year 2045, reality is an ugly place. The only time Wade Watts really feels alive is when he's jacked into the OASIS, a vast virtual world where most of humanity spends their days.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: Psychiatrist Viktor Frankl's memoir has riveted generations of readers with its descriptions of life in Nazi death camps and its lessons for spiritual survival.

title: The Mythical Man-Month
author: Frederick P. Brooks Jr.
description: Few books on software project management have been as influential and timeless as The Mythical Man-Month.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The Galactic Empire has ruled for 12,000 years. Now it is dying. Only Hari Seldon, creator of the revolutionary science of psychohistory, can see into the future.

title: Can't Hurt Me
author: David Goggins
description: For David Goggins, childhood was a nightmare. But through self-discipline, mental toughness, and hard work, Goggins transformed himself from a depressed, overweight young man into a US Armed Forces icon.

title: Grokking Algorithms
author: Aditya Bhargava
description: An illustrated guide for programmers and other curious people. This book makes algorithms fun and easy to understand.

title: Murder on the Orient Express
author: Agatha Christie
description: Just after midnight, the famous Orient Express is stopped in its tracks by a snowdrift. By morning, the millionaire Samuel Edward Ratchett lies dead in his compartment, stabbed a dozen times.

title: Kitchen Confidential
author: Anthony Bourdain
description: A deliciously funny, delectably shocking banquet of wild-but-true tales from life in the culinary trade from Chef Anthony Bourdain.

title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
author: Erich Gamma, et al.
description: Capturing a wealth of experience about the design of object-oriented software, four top-notch designers present a catalog of simple and succinct solutions to commonly occurring design problems.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins is a hobbit who enjoys a comfortable, unambitious life, rarely traveling further than his pantry or cellar. But his contentment is disturbed when the wizard Gandalf arrives.

title: Good to Great
author: Jim Collins
description: The findings of the Good to Great study will surprise many readers and shed light on virtually every area of management strategy and practice.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: In reality, Hiro Protagonist delivers pizza for Uncle Enzo’s CosoNostra Pizza Inc., but in the Metaverse he’s a warrior prince.

title: Building Microservices
author: Sam Newman
description: Distributed systems have become more fine-grained as organizations shift from monolithic applications to smaller, self-contained microservices.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A searching vision of an unequal, technologically-advanced future where humans are genetically bred, socially indoctrinated, and pharmaceutically anesthetized.

title: Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: The Lean Startup approach fosters companies that are both more capital efficient and that leverage human creativity more effectively.

title: Docker Deep Dive
author: Nigel Poulton
description: A comprehensive guide to learning Docker from scratch. Ideal for developers and system administrators.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: Six days ago, astronaut Mark Watney became one of the first people to walk on Mars. Now, he's sure he'll be the first person to die there.

title: Outliers
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: In this stunning book, Malcolm Gladwell takes us on an intellectual journey through the world of 'outliers'--the best and the brightest, the most famous and the most successful.

title: React Up and Running
author: Stoyan Stefanov
description: Hit the ground running with React, the open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: In order to develop a secure defense against a hostile alien race's next attack, government agencies breed child geniuses and train them as soldiers.

title: Freakonomics
author: Steven D. Levitt
description: A rogue economist explores the hidden side of everything. Freakonomics is a groundbreaking collaboration between Levitt and Stephen J. Dubner.

title: Learning SQL
author: Alan Beaulieu
description: Updated for the latest database management systems, this edition of Learning SQL will get you the knowledge you need to retrieve and manipulate data.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The hero-narrator of The Catcher in the Rye is an ancient child of sixteen, a native New Yorker named Holden Caulfield.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
author: Dale Carnegie
description: You can go after the job you want...and get it! You can take the job you have...and improve it! You can take any situation...and make it work for you!

title: Kubernetes: Up and Running
author: Kelsey Hightower
description: Legend has it that Google deploys over two billion application containers a week. How's that possible? This practical guide shows you how to deploy distributed applications using Kubernetes.

title: American Gods
author: Neil Gaiman
description: Shadow is a man with a past. But now he wants nothing more than to live a quiet life with his wife and stay out of trouble.

title: The 4-Hour Workweek
author: Timothy Ferriss
description: Forget the old concept of retirement and the rest of the deferred-life plan--there is no need to wait and every reason not to.

title: Rust Programming Language
author: Steve Klabnik
description: The official book on the Rust programming language, written by the Rust development team at the Mozilla Foundation.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Raskolnikov, a destitute and desperate former student, wanders through the slums of St Petersburg and commits a random murder without remorse or regret.

title: Thinking in Systems
author: Donella H. Meadows
description: In the years following her role as the lead author of the international bestseller, Limits to Growth, Donella Meadows remained a pioneer of environmental and social analysis.

title: Continuous Delivery
author: Jez Humble
description: Getting software released to users is often a painful, risky, and time-consuming process. This groundbreaking new book sets out the principles and technical practices that enable rapid, incremental delivery.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: The story of the tempestuous romance between the willful Scarlet O'Hara and the dashing Rhett Butler against the tragic backdrop of the Civil War.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
description: In The Power of Habit, Pulitzer Prize–winning business reporter Charles Duhigg takes us to the thrilling edge of scientific discoveries that explain why habits exist and how they can be changed.

title: Pattern of Enterprise Application Architecture
author: Martin Fowler
description: The practice of enterprise application development has benefited from the emergence of new enabling technologies... but design patterns remain the key.

title: Hyperion
author: Dan Simmons
description: On the world called Hyperion, beyond the reach of galactic law, waits the creature called the Shrike. There are those who worship it. There are those who fear it.

title: Cosmos
author: Carl Sagan
description: Cosmos is one of the bestselling science books of all time. In clear-eyed prose, Sagan reveals a jewel-like blue world inhabited by a life form that is just beginning to discover its own identity.

title: Site Reliability Engineering
author: Betsy Beyer
description: In this collection of essays and articles, key members of Google's Site Reliability Team explain how and why their commitment to the entire lifecycle has enabled the company to successfully build, deploy, monitor, and maintain some of the largest software systems in the world.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The classic vampire story. Jonathan Harker visits Transylvania to help Count Dracula purchase a London house and makes horrifying discoveries.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: A landmark volume in science writing by one of the great minds of our time, Stephen Hawking’s book explores such profound questions as: How did the universe begin?

title: The Art of Computer Programming
author: Donald Knuth
description: The bible of all fundamental algorithms and the work that taught many of today’s software developers most of what they know about computer programming.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: Jack Torrance's new job at the Overlook Hotel is the perfect chance for a fresh start. As the off-season caretaker at the atmospheric old hotel, he'll have plenty of time to spend reconnecting with his family and working on his writing.

title: Quiet: The Power of Introverts
author: Susan Cain
description: At least one-third of the people we know are introverts. They are the ones who prefer listening to speaking; who innovate and create but dislike self-promotion.

title: High Performance Browser Networking
author: Ilya Grigorik
description: How prepared are you today for when mobile takes over? This hands-on guide provides a complete overview of the performance networking technologies that drive the web.

title: A Discovery of Witches
author: Deborah Harkness
description: Deep in the stacks of Oxford's Bodleian Library, young scholar Diana Bishop unwittingly calls up a bewitched alchemical manuscript in the course of her research.

title: Extreme Ownership
author: Jocko Willink
description: Sent to the most violent battlefield in Iraq, Jocko Willink and Leif Babin’s SEAL task unit faced a seemingly impossible mission: help U.S. forces secure Ramadi.

title: Don't Make Me Think
author: Steve Krug
description: Since Don't Make Me Think was first published in 2000, over 400,000 Web designers and developers have relied on Steve Krug's guide to help them understand the principles of intuitive navigation and information design.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
description: Sixteen-year-old Starr Carter moves between two worlds: the poor neighborhood where she lives and the fancy suburban prep school she attends. The uneasy balance between these worlds is shattered.

title: Elon Musk
author: Ashlee Vance
description: Elon Musk is the Steve Jobs of the present and the future, and for the past twelve months, he has been shadowed by tech reporter, Ashlee Vance.

title: Code Complete
author: Steve McConnell
description: Widely considered one of the best practical guides to programming, Steve McConnell’s original CODE COMPLETE has been helping developers write better software for more than a decade.

title: It
author: Stephen King
description: The story of seven friends who lived in Derry, Maine, and the terror that stalked them as teenagers and returned to haunt them as adults.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: In this generation-defining self-help guide, a superstar blogger cuts through the crap to show us how to stop trying to be 'positive' all the time so that we can truly become better, happier people.

title: Implementing Domain-Driven Design
author: Vaughn Vernon
description: Vaughn Vernon presents concrete and realistic domain-driven design (DDD) techniques through examples from familiar domains.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: The son of a zookeeper, Pi Patel has an encyclopedic knowledge of animal behavior and a fervent love of stories. When Pi is sixteen, his family emigrates from India to North America aboard a Japanese cargo ship.

title: Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less
author: Greg McKeown
description: The Way of the Essentialist isn't about getting more done in less time. It's not about getting it all done. It's about getting only the right things done.

title: Soft Skills: The software developer's life manual
author: John Sonmez
description: Soft Skills: The software developer’s life manual is a unique guide, offering techniques and practices for a more satisfying life as a professional software developer.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: For years, rumors of the 'Marsh Girl' have haunted Barkley Cove, a quiet town on the North Carolina coast. So in late 1969, when handsome Chase Andrews is found dead, the locals immediately suspect Kya Clark.

title: Born to Run
author: Christopher McDougall
description: Isolated by Mexico's deadly Copper Canyons, the blissful Tarahumara Indians have honed the ability to run hundreds of miles without rest or injury.

title: Working Effectively with Legacy Code
author: Michael Feathers
description: Get more out of your legacy systems: more performance, functionality, reliability, and manageability. Is your code easy to change? Can you get nearly instantaneous feedback when you do change it?

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: In the house of Helios, god of the sun and mightiest of the Titans, a daughter is born. But Circe is a strange child--not powerful, like her father, nor viciously alluring like her mother.

title: Mindset: The New Psychology of Success
author: Carol S. Dweck
description: After decades of research, world-renowned Stanford University psychologist Carol S. Dweck, Ph.D., discovered a simple but groundbreaking idea: the power of mindset.

title: Refactoring to Patterns
author: Joshua Kerievsky
description: This book brings two great worlds of software development together: patterns and refactoring. It shows you how to use patterns to improve existing code.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind.

title: The Lean Product Playbook
author: Dan Olsen
description: The missing manual on how to apply Lean Startup to build products that customers love. The Lean Product Playbook is a practical guide to building products that customers love.

title: Release It!
author: Michael T. Nygard
description: A single dramatic software failure can cost a company millions of dollars - but can be avoided with simple changes to design and architecture.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
description: In Shaker Heights, a placid, progressive suburb of Cleveland, everything is planned--from the layout of the winding roads, to the colors of the houses.

title: Thinking in Bets
author: Annie Duke
description: Annie Duke, a former World Series of Poker champion turned business consultant, draws on examples from business, sports, politics, and (of course) poker to share tools anyone can use to embrace uncertainty.

title: Accelerate
author: Nicole Forsgren
description: This book presents both the findings and the science behind the State of DevOps reports, giving you evidence-based ways to measure software delivery performance.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: Connell and Marianne grow up in the same small town, but the similarities end there. At school, Connell is popular and well liked, while Marianne is a loner.

title: Measure What Matters
author: John Doerr
description: Legendary venture capitalist John Doerr reveals how the goal-setting system of Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) has helped tech giants from Intel to Google achieve explosive growth.

title: User Story Mapping
author: Jeff Patton
description: User story mapping is a valuable tool for software development, once you understand why and how to use it. This insightful book examines how this often misunderstood technique can help your team stay focused.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: The circus arrives without warning. No announcements precede it. It is simply there, when yesterday it was not.

title: Hooked
author: Nir Eyal
description: Why do some products capture widespread attention while others flop? What makes us engage with certain products out of sheer habit?

title: Sprint
author: Jake Knapp
description: From three partners at Google Ventures, a unique five-day process for solving tough problems, proven at more than a hundred companies.

title: Station Eleven
author: Emily St. John Mandel
description: An audacious, darkly glittering novel set in the eerie days of civilization's collapse—the spellbinding story of a Hollywood star, his would-be savior, and a nomadic group of actors roaming the scattered outposts of the Great Lakes region.

title: Range
author: David Epstein
description: David Epstein examined the world's most successful athletes, artists, musicians, inventors, forecasters and scientists. He discovered that in most fields—especially those that are complex and unpredictable—generalists, not specialists, are primed to excel.

title: Programming Pearls
author: Jon Bentley
description: Computer programming is a craft as well as a science. Programming Pearls, Second Edition, by Jon Bentley, is a collection of essays that offer a unique perspective on the craft of software development.

title: Dark Matter
author: Blake Crouch
description: Jason Dessen is walking home through the chilly Chicago streets one night, looking forward to a quiet evening in front of the fireplace with his wife, Daniela, and their son, Charlie—when his reality shatters.

title: Creativity, Inc.
author: Ed Catmull
description: From Ed Catmull, co-founder (with Steve Jobs and John Lasseter) of Pixar Animation Studios, the Academy Award–winning studio behind Inside Out and Toy Story, comes an incisive book about creativity in business.

title: Designing for the Digital Age
author: Kim Goodwin
description: Whether you're designing consumer electronics, medical devices, enterprise Web apps, or new ways to check out at the supermarket, today's digitally-enabled products and services provide both great opportunities to deliver value and great risks.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
description: A murder...A tragic accident...Or just parents behaving badly? What’s indisputable is that someone is dead.

title: Nudge
author: Richard H. Thaler
description: Nudge is about how we make these choices and how we can make better ones. Using dozens of eye-opening examples and drawing on decades of behavioral science research.

title: Refactoring: Ruby Edition
author: Jay Fields
description: The definitive refactoring guide, specifically for Ruby developers. Improve your Ruby code structure and maintainability.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
description: A young New Yorker grieving his mother's death is pulled into a gritty underworld of art and wealth.

title: Blink
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: Blink is a book about how we think without thinking, about choices that seem to be made in an instant--in the blink of an eye--that actually aren't as simple as they seem.

title: Java Concurrency in Practice
author: Brian Goetz
description: Threads are a fundamental part of the Java platform. This book provides a thorough list of concurrency pitfalls and patterns.

title: All the Light We Cannot See
author: Anthony Doerr
description: From the highly acclaimed, multiple award-winning Anthony Doerr, the beautiful, stunningly ambitious instant New York Times bestseller about a blind French girl and a German boy whose paths collide in occupied France as both try to survive the devastation of World War II.

title: Dare to Lead
author: Brené Brown
description: Leadership is not about titles, status, and wielding power. A leader is anyone who takes responsibility for recognizing the potential in people and ideas, and has the courage to develop that potential.

title: Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
author: Martin Fowler
description: Developers of enterprise applications (EA) are often faced with common problems. This book provides a catalog of patterns that have proven successful in EA development.

title: The Pillars of the Earth
author: Ken Follett
description: A spellbinding epic tale of ambition, anarchy, and absolute power set against the sprawling medieval canvas of twelfth-century England.

title: Team Topologies
author: Matthew Skelton
description: In Team Topologies, DevOps consultants Matthew Skelton and Manuel Pais share secrets of successful team patterns and interactions to help readers choose and evolve the right team patterns for their organization.

title: Test Driven Development
author: Kent Beck
description: Quite simply, Test Driven Development is meant to eliminate fear in application development.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: In the world of the near future, who will control women's bodies? Offred is a Handmaid in the Republic of Gilead.

title: Predictably Irrational
author: Dan Ariely
description: Why do our headaches persist after we take a one-cent aspirin but disappear when we take a fifty-cent aspirin? Why does recalling the Ten Commandments reduce our tendency to lie?

title: Unit Testing Principles, Practices, and Patterns
author: Vladimir Khorikov
description: Radically improve your testing practice and software quality with new testing styles, good patterns, and reliable automation.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: It is 1939. Nazi Germany. The country is holding its breath. Death has never been busier, and will become busier still.

title: Switch
author: Chip Heath
description: Why is it so hard to make lasting changes in our companies, in our communities, and in our own lives?

title: High Output Management
author: Andrew S. Grove
description: The essential skill of creating and maintaining new businesses—the art of the entrepreneur—can be summed up in a single word: managing.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: Paulo Coelho's enchanting novel has inspired a devoted following around the world. This story, dazzling in its powerful simplicity and soul-stirring wisdom, is about an Andalusian shepherd boy named Santiago.

title: Crucial Conversations
author: Kerry Patterson
description: Tools for talking when stakes are high. Crucial Conversations teaches readers how to handle disagreements and high-stakes communication.

title: Head First Java
author: Kathy Sierra
description: Head First Java is a complete learning experience in Java and object-oriented programming.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
description: When four classmates from a small Massachusetts college move to New York to make their way, they're broke, adrift, and buoyed only by their friendship and ambition.

title: Made to Stick
author: Chip Heath
description: Mark Twain once observed, 'A lie can get halfway around the world before the truth can even get its boots on.' His observation rings true: Urban legends, conspiracy theories, and bogus public-health scares circulate effortlessly.

title: C++ Primer
author: Stanley B. Lippman
description: Bestselling programming author Stanley B. Lippman and Josée Lajoie join forces with C++ expert Moo to provide an authoritative and comprehensive introduction to C++.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: Staring unflinchingly into the abyss of slavery, this spellbinding novel transforms history into a story as powerful as Exodus and as intimate as a lullaby.

title: Getting Things Done
author: David Allen
description: The Art of Stress-Free Productivity. Allen's premise is simple: our productivity is directly proportional to our ability to relax.

title: Effective C++
author: Scott Meyers
description: Scott Meyers' Effective C++ books are the gold standard for C++ programming guidelines.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Guy Montag is a fireman. His job is to destroy the most illegal of commodities, the printed book, along with the houses in which they are hidden.

title: Leaders Eat Last
author: Simon Sinek
description: Imagine a world where almost everyone wakes up inspired to go to work, feels trusted and valued during the day, then returns home feeling fulfilled.

title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
author: Harold Abelson
description: A classic text in computer science education, famously known as the Wizard Book.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: The wild and passionate story of the intense and almost demonic love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

title: Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us
author: Daniel H. Pink
description: The secret to high performance and satisfaction—at work, at school, and at home—is the deeply human need to direct our own lives.

title: Computer Systems: A Programmer's Perspective
author: Randal E. Bryant
description: This book explains the enduring concepts underlying all computer systems, and shows the concrete ways that these ideas affect the correctness, performance, and utility of application programs.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A young man purchases eternal youth at the expense of his soul in this romantic exposition of a double life.

title: Traction
author: Gino Wickman
description: Do you have a grip on your business, or does your business have a grip on you? All entrepreneurs and business leaders face similar frustrations.

title: Compilers: Principles, Techniques, and Tools
author: Alfred V. Aho
description: Known as the Dragon Book, this text covers the latest developments in compiler technology.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: Billy Pilgrim, a chaplain's assistant in the US Army during WWII, is captured by the Germans and survives the firebombing of Dresden.

title: Rework
author: Jason Fried
description: Rework shows you a better, faster, easier way to succeed in business. Read it and you'll know why plans are actually harmful, why you don't need outside investors, and why you're better off ignoring the competition.

title: Operating System Concepts
author: Abraham Silberschatz
description: Keep pace with the fast-moving world of operating systems with the newest edition of this classic book.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: Jane Eyre, a penniless orphan, is engaged as governess at Thornfield Hall by the mysterious Edward Rochester.

title: Flow
author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
description: Psychologist Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi's famous investigations of 'optimal experience' have revealed that what makes an experience genuinely satisfying is a state of consciousness called flow.

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
author: Stuart Russell
description: The most comprehensive, up-to-date introduction to the theory and practice of artificial intelligence.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: A powerful cultural touchstone of modern American literature, The Color Purple depicts the lives of African American women in early twentieth-century rural Georgia.

title: Built to Last
author: Jim Collins
description: Drawing upon a six-year research project at the Stanford University Graduate School of Business, James C. Collins and Jerry I. Porras took eighteen truly exceptional and long-lasting companies and studied each.

title: Refactoring UI
author: Adam Wathan
description: Learn how to design beautiful user interfaces by yourself using specific tactics explained from a developer's point-of-view.

title: Of Mice and Men
author: John Steinbeck
description: They are an unlikely pair: George is 'small and quick and dark of face'; Lennie, a man of tremendous size, has the mind of a young child.

title: Grit
author: Angela Duckworth
description: In this must-read book for anyone striving to succeed, pioneering psychologist Angela Duckworth shows parents, students, educators, athletes, and business people that the secret to outstanding achievement is not talent but a special blend of passion and persistence she calls 'grit.'

title: Understanding Distributed Systems
author: Roberto Vitillo
description: Learning to build distributed systems is hard, especially if they are large scale. This book covers the common recurring patterns.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: The Bell Jar chronicles the crack-up of Esther Greenwood: brilliant, beautiful, enormously talented, and successful, but slowly going under.

title: Antifragile
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
description: Nassim Nicholas Taleb reveals how to thrive in an uncertain world. Just as human bones get stronger when subjected to stress and tension, and rumors or riots intensify when someone tries to repress them, many things in life benefit from stress, disorder, volatility, and turmoil.

title: Fundamentals of Software Architecture
author: Mark Richards
description: Salary surveys worldwide regularly place software architect in the top 10 best jobs, yet no real guide exists to help developers become architects. Until now.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: In what may be Dickens's best novel, humble, orphaned Pip is apprenticed to the dirty work of the forge but dares to dream of becoming a gentleman.

title: Predictable Revenue
author: Aaron Ross
description: Discover the outbound sales process that, in just a few years, helped add $100 million in recurring revenue to Salesforce.com.

title: Don't Make Me Think, Revisited
author: Steve Krug
description: A Common Sense Approach to Web Usability. This book is a must-read for anyone working in web design or development.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: At the dawn of the next world war, a plane crashes on an uncharted island, stranding a group of schoolboys. At first, with no adult supervision, their freedom is something to celebrate.

title: The Hard Thing About Hard Things
author: Ben Horowitz
description: Ben Horowitz, cofounder of Andreessen Horowitz and one of Silicon Valley's most respected and experienced entrepreneurs, offers essential advice on building and running a startup.

title: Python for Data Analysis
author: Wes McKinney
description: Get complete instructions for manipulating, processing, cleaning, and crunching datasets in Python.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: Acclaimed by many as the world's greatest novel, Anna Karenina provides a vast panorama of contemporary life in Russia and of humanity in general.

title: Thinking in Java
author: Bruce Eckel
description: Thinking in Java has earned rave reviews from programmers worldwide for its extraordinary clarity, careful organization, and small but direct programming examples.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: Victor Hugo's tale of injustice, heroism, and love follows the fortunes of Jean Valjean, an escaped convict determined to put his criminal past behind him.

title: Fluent Python
author: Luciano Ramalho
description: Python's simplicity lets you become productive quickly, but this often means you aren't using everything it has to offer. With this hands-on guide, you'll learn how to write effective, idiomatic Python code.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: Set in Italy during World War II, this is the story of the incomparable, malingering bombardier, Yossarian, a hero who is furious because thousands of people he has never met are trying to kill him.

title: Hands-On Machine Learning
author: Aurélien Géron
description: Through a series of recent breakthroughs, deep learning has boosted the entire field of machine learning. Now, even programmers who know close to nothing about this technology can use simple, efficient tools.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning epic of the Great Depression, a book that galvanized—and sometimes outraged—millions of readers.

title: Pro Git
author: Scott Chacon
description: Git is the version control system developed by Linus Torvalds for Linux kernel development. This book provides an entire world of version control knowledge.

title: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
description: Ulysses chronicles the appointments and encounters of the itinerant Leopold Bloom in Dublin in the course of an ordinary day, 16 June 1904.

title: Designing Interfaces
author: Jenifer Tidwell
description: Despite all of the UI toolkits available today, it's still not easy to design good application interfaces. This book captures best practices.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab is an Obsessive captain of a whaling ship who is on a journey to find the white whale Moby Dick who bit off his leg.

title: The Linux Programming Interface
author: Michael Kerrisk
description: The Linux Programming Interface is the definitive guide to the Linux and UNIX system programming API.

title: Emma
author: Jane Austen
description: Beautiful, clever, rich--and single--Emma Woodhouse is perfectly content with her life and sees no need for either love or marriage.

title: Deep Learning
author: Ian Goodfellow
description: An introduction to a broad range of topics in deep learning, covering mathematical and conceptual background, deep learning techniques used in industry, and research perspectives.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A young scientist, Victor Frankenstein, creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: Spring Boot in Action
author: Craig Walls
description: Spring Boot in Action is a developer-focused guide to writing applications using Spring Boot.
